bibl.title: A Commercial Nursery near Abu Hummus (Egypt) and Re-use of Amphoras for the Trade in Plants.
bibl.note: The plant trade in Hellenistic and Roman Egypt. - The Beheira Survey and the re-discovery of the Abu Hummus nursery [on the Canopic branch of the Nile]. - Dating and phasing. - Re-use of amphoras as planting pots and the identification of a commercial plant nursery. - Commercial gardens and nurseries in Roman Italy. - Baskets and other ways to transport plants.
bibl.seg: Mohamed Kenawi, Elizabeth Macaulay-Lewis & Judith S. McKenzie, A Commercial Nursery near Abu Hummus (Egypt) and Re-use of Amphoras for the Trade in Plants.

The plant trade in Hellenistic and Roman Egypt. - The Beheira Survey and the re-discovery of the Abu Hummus nursery [on the Canopic branch of the Nile]. - Dating and phasing. - Re-use of amphoras as planting pots and the identification of a commercial plant nursery. - Commercial gardens and nurseries in Roman Italy. - Baskets and other ways to transport plants.
